body_html:
tf.contrib.optimizer_v2.AdamOptimizer fixes this issue: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/optimizer_v2/adam.py
…
On Fri, May 25, 2018 at 1:32 AM sdr2002 ***@***.***> wrote: I do not know why this issue is closed, but for TF1.8.0 this issue still alive. Those 'beta1_power' and 'beta2_power' are not within the variable_scope unlike other variables. — You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8057 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxdWcxdjbZrLxAizLPyxEgumfdiJ5ks5t18GPgaJpZM4MScRa> .
-- - Alex
body_text:
tf.contrib.optimizer_v2.AdamOptimizer fixes this issue:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/optimizer_v2/adam.py

…
On Fri, May 25, 2018 at 1:32 AM sdr2002 ***@***.***> wrote:
 I do not know why this issue is closed, but for TF1.8.0 this issue still
 alive.
 Those 'beta1_power' and 'beta2_power' are not within the variable_scope
 unlike other variables.

 —
 You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.

body:
tf.contrib.optimizer_v2.AdamOptimizer fixes this issue:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/optimizer_v2/adam.py

On Fri, May 25, 2018 at 1:32 AM sdr2002 <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I do not know why this issue is closed, but for TF1.8.0 this issue still
> alive.
> Those 'beta1_power' and 'beta2_power' are not within the variable_scope
> unlike other variables.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/8057#issuecomment-391981229>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxdWcxdjbZrLxAizLPyxEgumfdiJ5ks5t18GPgaJpZM4MScRa>
> .
>


-- 
 - Alex
